column2: Students should wear what they like and feel free about their clothes.
People cannot be forced to wear school uniforms. Each person has their own wish whether or not they want to wear school uniforms. I think each principal should reconsider this issue.

That form of argument degrades this forum and will cause the arguments to fall to the lowest common denominator. I dispute your claim from personal experience, if nothing else, that makes it disputable. I think Yahoo! has chat rooms more attuned to your style of debate. Check them out.
I would not turn her in because she is my wife and we can get over it. If she trusted me by telling me what she did, then I could not do that to her.
I would not turn in my spouse because the woman I married killed someone does not make her a terrible person.
TV is terrible except for Spongebob. However, most of the television is terrible so I would have to say books based on that.
My English teacher said that books improve your literature.
You save money by reading a book. You do not need to buy any devices to read a book, and you do not need to use electricity.
I think that books are better than television because you can put yourself in a whole North Yorkshire and it is educational.

Books enlighten the soul. Books throw the mind into a series of questions. Books take the reader to mystical places, paradise, and even the kitchen sink. They change your perspective on life and often give the reader a sense of relativity. Television is like a drug. It is as bad as nicotine.

India has strong military neighbors, China and Pakistan. India has territorial disputes and fought four wars for this. India has become tense with China due to territorial disputes and India interference in Pakistan. Pakistan has long term plans for the Pak China Economic Corridor and Gawadar Mega Oil City.
India is a terrible country.
India is a good adopter but a bad developer. The leader should be a great developer.

According to a recent report 50% scientists in NASA are indian IITians. Just imagine that if those scientists will join ISRO then India's status,value and astronomical knowledge of India will definetly increase.

I would rather be completely fatherless, not saying that not having is better than having one, albeit a lousy one. However, I do believe that you can grow up completely fatherless and without any major male role model and still be successful.

Being fatherless is probably one of the biggest hardships, undesired by everyone. I would rather be fatherless, than to have to deal with someone who would frustrate me daily. On the other hand, a bad father would be with you in your thoughts forever.
Raffles was followed by Farquhar during his visit to Singapore. This shows that Raffles saw Singapore before Farquhar became the founder.
Raffles had written his discovery wrongly as 29 February 1819. However, it was later corrected. He thought he had discovered Singapore on his first journey to India.
Without Raffles, Singapore would have remained a sparsely inhabited island, on the margins of the Dutch colonial empire in the East Indies.

Raffles established a local magistrate in Singapore. This magistrate led to activities such as public gambling and slavery being controlled. Farquar protected Singapore from the Dutch attacks and attracted traders to Singapore while Raffles was away.
That is interesting because the burden of proof rests with you to prove that we are still evolving. I haven't noticed mankind change form for a few thousand years.

I am a nurse and the more I studied biology, the more I was amazed at the miracle of our bodies. When you look at a computer do you question that there had to be a creator or do you need proof that this highly organized machine came about by a mere accident or order of circumstances?
I voted for evolution, because creationism is easier to accept due to the fact that someone somewhere had to change aspects of the universe in order for us to exist.
Believing evolution is like believing the puzzle can be broken by pouring the pieces out because two pieces are stuck together.
The extensions leak memory like a sieve. An opened session of Firefox 2.0.0.1 uses 250 MB of memory under Task Manager on Windows.

PE should be compulsory because it keeps us constantly fit and healthy. If you really dislike sports, then you can quit it when you are an adult. But when you are a kid, the best thing for you to do is study, play and exercise. If you prefer to be lazy and lie on the couch all day, then you are most likely to get sick and unfit.

Founders should be leaders who are respected by the organization or group they are managing. William Farquhar was a good leader. However, when he was sent off to Britain, more people went to send him off than the combined number of people that sent Raffles off during the three times Raffles left Singapore. This shows that the people of Singapore respected Farquhar more than Raffles, and to them, Farquhar was a more competent leader.
I know many children get adopted but many do not and it might be better off to have an abortion to let them suffer. Who are we to decide on one woman's pregnancy?
Who is it that judges what is right and wrong? Can we not just let people make decisions and live with the consequences?
We are evolving. Look at this one. Our small toe is becoming increasingly smaller. Eventually, it will end up losing it.
I understand that people have religious beliefs and that is fine. However, it is scientifically proven that evolution is correct. What is your point?

Why do we not have talking monkeys? That is a red herring. Monkeys have not evolved to talk because they are incapable of speech. However, we, on the other hand, have evolved to talk. Yes, if we are descended from monkeys that doesn't stop them from existing. We are a branch on the tree of life.
Porn is not wrong, but if it is really wrong, then it should be "illegal".
Porn is not inherently wrong because it can't substantially harm anyone who isn't involved in it by choice. It really is just as simple as that.
Yes, they are either virgins or still live at home with their mothers and cannot have porn.

It is not wrong, and if you are talking about the actors doing the scene, it is their choice. They like doing it, and it is not degrading to women who want to do it. We have freedom of expression, you know, and it also helps some of us to be open about sex.

There was a rapper who said he was the people's champ. When you want to be successful, you need to worry about the common good. I believe that advancing the common good is a better endeavor. Because when you always think about your self and your personal pursuits, you tend to become conceited and become an A jerk.

I believe they are different ways of feeling happy and proud of what you do. I feel happy helping others, but that does not mean I help every person in front of me. I try to do what I think is best and good to make someone happy.
I think common good is better than personal pursuit because it is better to help other people. It makes me feel good to be doing something good in my life.
It is a good thing because it shows that the school and everyone else accepts each other no matter where they come from, who they are, or what religion they are.
Wearing school uniforms, you can be certain that you are going to school to study, and not show off your fashion sense.

Uniforms allow an equal and fair social status based on personality, not looks. I admit wearing what you want is fun and creative, but it is only fun if everyone can do it. For some children, that is not the case and they cannot afford to live up to their peers standards.

The school uniform is a very good idea, why? Because the school uniform makes pupils concentrate on their education rather than their clothes, and I believe that it instills discipline among pupils. It also makes pupils with different material statuses more equal.
If you do not have a father, then you have no way of knowing that you will never feel the same way about someone for the rest of your life.
There is scientific evidence that shows having a mother and a father is the healthiest way for a child to progress physically and mentally. A lousy father is better than none.
I would rather have the hope that my father could be a good father than know that I will never meet him. I would be too curious as to what kind of father he could have been.
Atlas would drop the world for a chance to shake his hand.

The increase in bottled water production has led to water shortages in areas near bottling plants. Additionally, two gallons of water are wasted in the purification process for every gallon that goes into the bottles.
Water bottles can be used for many different purposes. For example, they can be used as clothing or carpet. It is easy to just fill a cup with water and then use it again.
TV is better than reading books from the olden days.
Television is better than books.
I love TV because you can watch whatever you want and it is the best. You can also watch DVDs and play on Playstation.
Most Americans recycle more than half of their bottle waters.
Without plastic water bottles, there is no sunshine. There is only darkness everyday.
We will be able to ban water bottles until we get out of this recession.

This idea is essentially playing with semantics. I did not propose that there be a separate but identical marriage for homosexual relationships and that it be called "civil unions." "Furthermore, the effects on society are bound to be minimal." This is the type of reasoning that the slippery slope argument applies perfectly. Why not let any small group demand a change with little relative impact? "...why challenge any assumption?" I'm not arguing that law should not change. I'm arguing that law developed under one set of assumptions should be blindly applied to a different scenario.
There is no such thing as "gay marriage." Marriage is only between a man and a woman.

I am ashamed to admit that India is rich due to slavery. India never had slavery and used to be rich until the British came and took everything away. We were left in a bad state, but started developing quickly. India is much more competitive in education than America. Soon, everyone will have education and India will excel.

India is a secular state, and people from all communities reside here. Therefore, India has knowledge of almost all countries and the way they live. Therefore, it can easily lead all people of the world without creating any nuissance among anyone.

How can Indians say that India does not have the potential to lead the world? India is heaven on earth and only India has the potential to lead the world. Believe yourself and hard work. India will become a potential leader in the world.
I say no because spanking does not solve the problem. Anyone can get over a spanking quickly and do the same thing again. It is better to be strict than to abuse a child.

It depends on the severity of the act. Of course I would be empathetic towards my husband and want him free, but if I knew it was a malicious act instead of self defense or to defend his family or belongings I would most likely leave and not have anything to do with it.
I would turn them in because I do not think that killing someone and then letting them go is wrong. Additionally, I do not want to be next to a murderer on my bed.

I would turn them in regardless of the risk. Any person who commits murder should not get away with it because if they did it once they can do it again. Also, if I do not turn them in, then I will not know that later on in life I might be a victim.
The government does not have a place to tell a woman what she can do with her own body. However, the government does have a right.
I am pro-life. What is the question for those who are pro-life? Is the child in the mother's womb alive or not? If not, how do you know?
How can you argue against that? In Nebraska, abortion is legal, as long as the fetus is killed at the time of birth.

There should be no argument about this, if you see a fetus as a living being that has been created in a very intimate way. You should not be changing what Mother Nature, God, fate or whatever has decided for you. And if you did not want to get pregnant in the first place, you should not have sex or use protection. There are some women that get raped and it is very unfortunate, but they should give the child up for adoption. It is not the child's fault that it was created. So why should the guinea pig be responsible for the ultimate price of its life?

There are many ways to not get pregnant. Condoms are 99% effective for men and women, morning-after pills are 75% effective, the patch, pill, and other forms of ways to not get pregnant. It is the woman's fault that she did not do it. And maybe instead of Pro-choice vs. Pro-life, they should have pro-life, but with exceptions for women that get raped so that it is fair all-around.

If a woman is raped it is a good argument. However, why would you punish an innocent baby with the death penalty for some other man's crime? If the woman does not want the child she could give it up for adoption. I do not understand why you would kill the baby. The emotional trauma would happen without the baby.
I believe homosexual marriage should be allowed. People who do not want it to be allowed simply do not like homosexuality all together, and therefore the opposing side tends to be prejudice.

Marriage is found in almost every society, including those that were never touched by Christianity or Judaism, and those that predated Christianity. The Bible can only be argued to be the origin of Christian marriage, but that is difficult to prove.
You cannot choose someone's lifestyle if you do not agree with it. You cannot call someone's lifestyle a "choice" if you are not that person and know that homosexuality was not a "choice."

If you do not like gay marriage and think it is wrong, then do not watch a gay couple kiss. Who are you to tell people that their views are incorrect and that they must change their feelings? Meanwhile, everyone is entitled to their opinions, but keep them to themselves.

I think that personal pursuit is more important because in order to help others you have to help yourself first. This may seem selfish but once you reach a point where you are good at what you do, you can help others do the same.

Politics is very useful to people. The nation we live in exists because it is built around laws and values the people support. Without police I would be afraid to go outside without a gun. Think more theoretically. Why do terrorists blow up every city here? I mean are they frisked every time you leave your house? No. Politics is the governing body that has developed public safety. It is supposed to be built by the people it governs. Arguments happen so people can learn to understand one another and learn. It is okay to debate. You do not have to always be right but take time to learn. It is not politics that destroys people, it is the media projecting it.
I am a direct threat to the government Bush is trying to create.
It is as old as known history. The earliest civilizations practiced it back in Mesopotamia, which is older than Egypt. It was not created by the "white devil" that you hear about today.

Do you want to have contact with your children? Then you need to step up and fight for them. California is fair when it comes to fathers. Your children have legal rights to have contact with you unless you are found unfit for some reason. You need to find an attorney within the jurisdiction from the lastest court order. Good luck and you really need to fight for this.

I am not a lawyer, and you should probably speak with one, but my two cents are that you must not exercise any of the rights granted to you in Section 3 above in any manner that is primarily intended for or directed toward commercial advantage or private monetary compensation. The exchange of the Work for other copyrighted works by means of digital file-sharing or otherwise shall not be considered to be intended for or directed toward commercial advantage or private monetary compensation, provided there is no payment of any monetary compensation in connection with the exchange of copyrighted works.
Your brother is in jail for a reason. Maybe if he had contributed to society instead of committing crimes he would not be in jail.

Yes, if you execute a murderer, he will never escape. He will never hurt anyone else, and it helps the victim's family heal. The thought that a murderer is still alive grates on the minds and heartsof the victims.

Skating in general is not illegal, but in certain public places it is illegal. I used to work at a store where we had kids skate on our sidewalk and they nearly killed some of our elderly customers. That is why it is illegal in some places because you could run over people who are just walking around.

You cannot legislate how someone should feel about another person. While racism is bad, it is inherently protected by the First Amendment. Try to avoid the question of "why isn't the government doing anything about it?" They love to take away freedoms rather than protect them, so I would rather they stay out of it. Free speech allows civilized people to keep track of the crazies.

Usually, that isn't the question men are asking. Maybe you are not the father, but the mom. My bad. If you were the dad, you could always just give extra money that didn't go through the courthouse. Otherwise, you can request a review, which takes awhile to complete, but child support offices go to the employer and verify all of the income, and then reevaluate the amount per month owed. Some states give cost of living increases every year, but some don't. Don't listen to the jerks telling you that you should be able to support the child on your own. You didn't get pregnant on your own, and you sure shouldn't have to support that child on your own.

Unfortunately, I agree that unless there is something in it for us, it is a hard sell to convince the United States to send troops to protect the world. The problem is that we always get caught up in the quagmire of international politics and never fully commit to a mission, thus we fall short and it looks like a half-hearted attempt with consequences that we have a hard time stomaching.

If you are connected to city sewers, you have to pay. Check with your city councilman. They probably negotiated a billing delay when they were first installed, even if it was a city oversight. It is a service you have to pay for. They charged me extra sewer when I filled my pool and that was 6000 gallon worth of water even though it didn't go down the drain. If they can charge you, they will. Especially if all your neighbors are connected, they do not give you a choice.

Unlike what most people believe, most states do not have laws addressing minimum ages to babysit or minimum ages that children can be left alone. Unless someone can cite a specific Illinois law, chances are the answers you get here are of little value. While 15 or 16 might seem like reasonable numbers, that does not mean the answers are correct on the law.

In a free society, there is no such thing as the "right" to not be subjected to offensive things. However, if you read the newspaper, browse the web, watch TV, etc., you will be offended in the West. However, you do have the right to protest peacefully, picket, and rally other people to do the same. If their "deen" (a Muslim word for faith) is strong, they should not worry about what some non-Muslim has to say about their religion.

I feel that it is totally against everything that is American. For example, how about everyone strapping a GPS system to their legs so the government knows where everyone is. And yes, cell phones. I think that a standard driver's license will make the country safer against terrorists. Many of the 9/11 terrorists had drivers licenses that they would not have been able to obtain under the stringent requirements you are putting in your bill. The licenses will be granted and regulated by the Department of Homeland Security. The program will be funded by the fees paid by the drivers, so it will not need tax revenues. It will actually remove a burden from the states.

Do you mean Che Guevara, the Cuban revolutionary leader? Well, let's quote Che. He once wrote "you can kill a man, but you cannot kill an idea." He was writing about how the idea of freedom from oppression is catching on and will spread regardless of attempts to stamp it out. There is still oppression in the world, and there is still a thirst for freedom from it. So why not? The same basic conditions apply as when he was alive.

In one sense you bring up an interesting point. However, let me challenge you with a broader concept......do our Laws reflect our morality, or does morality stem from the Laws we make each other abide by? In their written series of civilization, Will and Ariel Durant made the point that man did not need or make laws until he thought his neighbor needed them. Consider that a bit as you ponder your own question. In my personal opinion, I do believe that faith can and should inform public policy.

The court will hold the conviction addulled, void, and overturned as if it no longer exists. Expungement of the records is another matter that requires more legal work. Even if that were to be granted, there will always be a paper trail and the fact that someone was arrested in the first place will always be part of that trail. It is practically impossible to get rid of all of the records, even with a court order.

It is not an appropriate function of government to make us "be good"; if it were, we would soon have laws forcing us to exercise and eat spinach. Our current drug policy is doing more harm than the drugs themselves.

You are not racist for wanting your family to have the same rights as the others. In fact, you should have more rights if you were born and bred in the country. However, unfortunately, that is not the case here in Britain. We actually have less rights and receive less benefits if we become unemployed or sick as compared to the imigrants who get much more of our money that we worked for which they take.
It may just be that Michigan is a bad economy and unemployment is high, but there are plenty of people with criminal records who would not be hired.
This is an interesting question in light of the laws that punish some people more severely than others for their opinion, even when they commit the same crime.

Why on earth do people answer questions when they have no idea what they are talking about? Sandytoes, asking a court clerk will do no good because they are not permitted to give legal advice. Why do you say that the judgment is expired? What state do you live in? In California, judgements expire after 10 years. The only way to get it off your credit report is to petition the court to have it expunged. Chances are really slim on that. Otherwise, you are probably just going to have to deal with it being there.

I think you have a case. Did you happen to take pictures of all of these "repairs"? Sometimes the threat of small claims court will get them to write a cheque. You may have to pay a lawyer to write the court documents, unless the clerk is willing to help you out. You did agree to the repairs, but you could argue that you expected them to be close to the original quality. The fact that they tried to repair the stand indicates they insured the UNIT part also. Good luck.

You need to protect yourself and your family if you have a person break into your home in the middle of the night. Even if you do call the police, you could be killed a hundred times over in five minutes.

I think prostitution is overrated. If a woman wants to have sex with many men and gets nothing, she is considered a whore. However, if the men throw her a few dollars, she is a prostitute. Why give it up for free?

We should close our borders and not allow these people to be taken care of. They can learn to speak English before coming over to her to take the test. If I go to a foreign country I do not expect them to take the time to teach me their language. It is not realistic. They need to go home and fix their country, while we try to fix ours.

There are many types of abuse. Perhaps she does not want you around anymore. Perhaps it is payback for something you did to her. This restraining order can be a piece of mind, "If he is not around me, he cannot hurt me anymore." It may provide a safe area for the heart to rest easier.
Firstly, cops do not piss you off. You choose to be. If you choose not to be pissed off, then you will not be. It is called a victim mentality. You own your emotions, no one else.
I believe that crime needs to be controlled and I do not personally see it as a violation of one's right's to be stopped when it is deemed to be suspicious.

You are mistaken, they have not been shut down in India. The ban is only in Maharastra. The government had received complaints from housewives about their male family members wasting money on ladies bars and not looking after the families. Also many criminal activities took place at these bars. You must be aware of the Tarannum case or the Telgi case where the monthly income was arouned 1 lac and the Telgi would throw away nereby 1 lac per day on the bar girls. To put a stop on such type of criminal activities the Gov of Maharastra had put a ban on these ladies bars.
The Indian Wars were more of a war of attrition, and we have contributed to the land.

Another thing to think about. While some judges can be bought, they are not the real problem. The philosophy for being a judge is to have no political affiliation, to be fair and impartial, to listen to the merits of each case separately and as presented. But some judges, especially a couple of new Supreme Court Justices, do not feel the need to represent the law, leaving their political views outside their courtrooms. Worse than one crooked judge in a million is the zealot who believes it is his or her responsibility to "fix" what he or she believes is wrong in the world - and now has the power to do that! Scary stuff.

Men in many developed countries have the legal right to abort in the case of an unplanned pregnancy. However, men often have *less* than no rights in cases involving potential parenthood. Men not only lack the right to choose whether or not they want the child to exist, but also whether or not they will support the child financially. If a woman has the ability to choose whether or not she wants to become a biological mother, it isn't justifiable to take away that decision from the biological father.

I have grown up around religious people who always told me abortion was wrong, murder, and immoral. But I slowly realized that it's not really a fully formed human, how could it be murder? This never made any sense, it's someone's body, if they want to abort a pregnancy, let them. Do not shame them into having a baby based on religious views.

I do not understand how the adversarial judicial system helps to get at the truth. It seems more about how well an argument is presented than the facts of the case. The way that both parties draw conclusions and attempt to manipulate the jury with emotional language into believing them seems deceptive. In addition, the jury, who are basically untrained (in terms of weighing evidence), people decide which argument is better seems to be a poor method of getting at the truth.

I don't think humanity has another 100 years left. I want to believe that things will be alright, but when you keep hearing worse and worse news about the environmental degradation of the planet (even if you are still somehow a climate-change denier, you have to admit the oceans are massively polluted and huge amounts of fish are dying, the air in some parts of the world like China is almost unbreathable and getting worse, etc.), it's hard to see humans coming out of this okay.

I believe that organizing parties with dress codes that allow people to dress up as racial stereotypes should be frowned upon and ultimately banned. By allowing these parties to go on as a college community, we are furthering the segregation, discrimination, and undermining of our international cultures as they are portrayed as a "joke" to those who attend in attire.
I understand that the Wilhelm scream is an "in-joke" but I do not think that it should be used anymore without the audience acknowledging it.

Prostitution stings should be illegal, and drug deal stings. Anything that does not have a victim, and there is no physical harm/bad intentions. If a police officer witnesses a drug deal or a prostitution deal, that is one thing. However, setting people up for these crimes, it seems as if the police are "shopping" for criminals to take in, baiting and reeling them in. Often times, these people may have gone about their days without committing a crime.

The title is self explanatory. Vladimir Putin is the head of a disappointed ex-empire, willing to gain its former glory. The Russian people are traditionally obedient one, willing to submit to an autocratic will, and ready to devote themselves to general patriotic ideals. The guy seems very determined not to conform with the Western moral and politic values.

With the exception of the moon where the dirt bike is amazing to rack up coins with flips and crazy air time, the race car is the superior vehicle. On maps like the beach and the cave the down force keeps you down on the big hills and keeps you in the ground. On Highway and Rollercoaster, forget about it, it's tailor made for those levels. Another huge downside of the bike is it's so flippy, if you get onto a hill and you lose momentum you end up doing a back flip and you slip backwards and can't get back up without a run up. With the race car, once you get forward momentum the downforce keeps your front end down and you will get up any hill. CMV!

First of all, we people are very greedy. We like to scrimp if we can, so we can pocket the difference. $8B, according to Forbes is its budget. If it was so useless, or even if Congress felt they could get away without it, they would immediately remove it. $8B more! They'd raise their pay! But they don't. Why wouldn't they? Because they think it serves some sort of purpose, and I am assuming it is the one of protecting the USA. Secondly, it is evolving. You have seen new security measures every year and while yes, they are annoying, they may have potentially saved your life. How's that for throwing away 500ml of water and standing in queue for 30min? I can see that many people in reddit disagree with this, however, and I want to know why, so I can form a balanced opinion. So CMV!

I am under the impression that a man's first love is his strongest love and every subsequent love is a bit weaker each time. Additionally, each subsequent love is trying to match the intensity of the first love, a bit like chasing the dragon after taking a drug for the first time.

I don't think Michael Jackson's death was truly accidental, but it seems to be the norm for people who die young. To see one's bad deeds scrubbed away on Earth with no one to speak of them again just feels wrong and downplays their earthly acts. I think speaking ill of the dead who did bad things should totally be acceptable and death should not be a cleanse to one's legacy. Am I alone here?

I believe some actions should have permanent consequences, and that we have morally compromised ourselves in making exceptions to this. I fundamentally contradict that every individual has a right to live. If you are willing to put someone else's right to life in jeopardy, then you have demonstrated that you are a net negative impact on society, and that as a whole we would all be better off if you were dead.

I am not talking about my parents here. They are wonderful people. I mean grandparents, cousins, uncles, aunts, etc. (Not brothers or sisters either, only child). Most of my parents' argument is that my family won't be around forever and that they would do anything for me. The thing is, I don't care that they would. It's similar to having some stranger say they would do anything for you.
If you are on a beer run with friends and one of them forgets their ID but they are not purchasing, requiring them to show ID is both useless and inconvenient.

I believe John Hammond had a great vision, but was poorly advised by his HR department. Hammond's Park would be a major boost for the economy of the Dominican Republic and any other nation where it opens up.

Video games should be treated like drugs. Millions of lives are affected because people are not monitored or do not use them in moderation. Children in particular are consumed and obsessed with them, it takes over their lives and social skills. It is sad. I feel strongly about this. I went through the same thing as a child and I wish more than anything to go back and change it. Also, I'm grateful because now I want to make sure that this does not happen to anyone again.

It is pointless. I do not see any positive things about it. It is not the best way to communicate with people since we have phones, email, instant messenger, video calls, and video chats. The apps have no meaning and are not that fun. I also do not understand why anyone would want to post about their feelings or what they are doing and shout it out to everyone. I do not care if Billy Bob is going shopping. It is also a place for online and maybe real life stalkers and maybe future stalkers.

If Iraq has taught us anything, it is that brutal dictators have their place in the world. If this administration had any brains at all, they would have had a Delta squad hunkered down right under the gallows with a stepstool, ready to spirit Saddam away from his rightful place at the capital. It takes a mean bastard to run a 160,000 square-mile lunatic asylum.
Professor X could probably take them all out by himself without all the other gods like marvel characters.

Yes, it will recover, provided the government stops its meddling and bailout measures. It was things like this that turned the potentially temporary market drop into a huge and horrid Great Depression. I wish lawmakers HAD TO TAKE AT LEAST SOME INTERESTED HISTORY WHILE IN HIGH SCHOOL.

I hear all too often that science is 'playing God'. We as a species have superceded the need for natural selection. We must control our evolution to ensure our survival. Ever since 1999 we have decoded the human genome, and it is time we manipulate it.

Unless every single gun that is issued legally is tested with ballistics before being issued so that any bullet fired from a licensed gun can be traced, if found intact, then guns pose a threat because there is no way for those bullets to be traced back to the owners so they can account for the shots they fired. It is like giving someone a Jaguar as long as they promise never to let it out of their site. It is a waste of money.

Emergency psychiatric evaluations are not an arrest, nor are they available for review by an employer. The American Disabilities Act prevents this, and gives you grounds for a law suit if it is used against you. You need to make your employer aware of your condition, and if he fires you, you will file a claim with the American Disabilities Association. Chances are they will deny your claim if you did not make them aware of your condition prior to employment. After the ADA reviews this, you will be given a "right to sue" letter. You will then be given a "right to sue" letter. You will then be given a "right to sue" letter. You will then be able to get a lawyer involved, and he will argue that you did not make your employer aware of your condition prior to employment because they would not have hired you in the first place. Many lawyers work pro bono and have a field day with employers like these.

Although eBay serves only as a market medium for connecting suppliers with consumers, it is better from an economic perspective. With no firmly set prices, eBay's market closely resembles an internet-based free market where consumers pay the prices they are willing to pay and suppliers supply goods for what they are willing to supply them for. In other words, this is a self-targeting market which operates (with the exception of delivery problems) at optimum efficiency. Amazon on the other hand used to use consumer price-targeting, in other words they would raise prices on certain books for certain users they found to be more likely to purchase certain kinds of books. It was only after they were caught that they decided to stop the price targetting. Now they are setting prices based on what the product suppliers are setting them at, they may not be working at optimum efficiency.

The vast majority of the answers above make the same mistake that the question implies. It is not the free exercise clause that deals with discrimination against gays. The issue is the Establishment Clause: "Congress shall make no law respecting the establishment of religion..." As interpreted, that basically means that religious reasoning cannot be used to justify secular laws. Those who try to use the Bible (or any other moral justification) to discriminate against gays seem to think that they can use their religion to make laws, because they are in the majority. As long as nobody else bases any legal actions on a different religion. It's pure hypocrisy and pure religious discrimination. And while people are certainly entitled to either on a personal level, they cannot do so as a matter of law.

I've slowly been losing belief in morality. I tend to find the whole thing odd. There's this weird quality that lies outside of the physical realm and cannot be justified by it. Because you can't easily leap from something existing to something moral without something being taken as axiomatic. I can't seem to find any reason to believe that I should make that jump. *Why* should I believe in some magical moral rule when the world seems so clearly explainable without it? *Why* should I believe that it's anything but a bunch of illusions created by mammals that need incentives for prosocial behavior? Raffles had a vision for Singapore that it would be orderly, elegant, rational and modern. However, while he was gone, Farquhar developed Singapore poorly, causing Raffles to feel disappointed.

If William Farquhar was to be proclaimed the founder because he did the "grunt work", should the supervisor of a construction site get the most commission, instead of the contractor? And besides, Raffles left Singapore under the orders of his superiors and he did not leave of free will.

William Farquhar was the one who remained in Singapore to keep it running and also developed it further, but Raffles was the one who gave him the position because he had to leave and return to Bencoolen. He was also the one who laid out the foundation of Singapore's development, so he should be considered a founder.
Schooling Raffles established the Singapore Institution, which was completed in 1837.

Raffles conceived a town plan to redesign Singapore into a modern city. The plan consisted of separate areas for different ethnic groups and provision of other facilities such as roads, schools and land for government buildings.
Raffles found that Farquhar had done a poor job of raising the city of Singapore. He also introduced opium sales to Singapore in order to raise more money to build Singapore.

Bottled water is not regulated as is tap water, so you have no idea what you are drinking.

I do not think that water bottles should be allowed anywhere unless it is an emergency. Plastic bottles can leak chemicals after a period of time. Even if tap water is dirty, you can easily clean it out with leaves, moss, and some water cleanser. Nearly one in five tested water bottles have bacteria anyway.

Over 1.5 million barrels of oil were used to make plastic bottles consumed in the US last year, and that is not including the petroleum used to transport them. That is enough petroleum to power 100,000 automobiles for a year.

In New York City alone, the transportation of bottled water from western Europe released an estimated 3,800 tons of global warming pollution into the atmosphere. Additionally, 18 million gallons of bottled water were shipped in from Fiji in 2006.

The dismissal of the lawsuit leaves open the possibility of re-filing the lawsuit or otherwise attempting to collect the claimed debt. "Without prjeudice", means that the case was not adjudicated and no resolution has been reached. However, at this point you have grounds for a counter-action if they continue to pursue this claim or make harmful statements to credit reporting agencies. You can ask an attorney to help with a formal letter to the company advising them that you will take such action. You should include copies of any derogatory material on any credit reports, and demand that these be corrected. Additionally, you should notify the credit reporting agencies that the report is incorrect and demand a change. In this manner, you protect your interests - and, if the company is foolish enough to try again, you are positioned to sue them in return and make a wad.

The primary shortcoming in any public opinion poll is that there is a tendency toward bias at every stage of the questioning process. The person asking the question has his bias; the person who wrote the question has his bias; and the person who answered the question has a bias as well. The former two forms of bias should ideally not show up in the results of an ethically conducted poll, however they often do. The second most important shortcoming is that small and/or homogeneous samples are used to save money or time or both. Sometimes homogeneous and small samples are used by unethical poll takers to influence the outcome of their poll. In short, polls will never be 100% helpful until they are designed, executed, and administered with practically no human intervention whatsoever. But what's the fun in that?

We had the rib taco and the brisket taco. The food was excellent. You may want to call ahead for a reservation as it gets busy.
We went to Zeta's for lunch. My husband had the gyro and I had the meat shawarma pita. Both were great. They served pita bread and olive oil at the beginning. It was definitely homemade.

I was very impressed with the food, drinks and the patio. I found the service to be a little slow but I like that at times. The nachos were delicious and my fish tacos were full of flavor and authentic tasting. The Caesar was one of the best I've ever had.

I went there at 10/20/2013 around 6pm with a group of 6. Ordered hummus as appetizer and the main entrees were potato pizza, lobster gnocchi, roast chicken and burgers. All of us experienced diarrhea during the night, some with acid reflex and gas disturbance. I will not be returning there again.

There is not much else in Mesa for wine bars, but D'Vine has always been a pleasant refuge when wanting to stay in town. It is right around the corner from my house and saves me driving into Gilbert or Scottsdale. The food has always been tasty and the staff friendly. The live music has been great so far. I wish they would stay open a little later on the weekends for us night owls.

I am so in love with this place that we haven't been back in a while. We tend to forget about it a bit because it's nothing flashy, but the food is consistently excellent. Chicken, beef, and shrimp are excellent. Rice, beans, and plantains are also excellent. My only disappointment was that I tried dessert and it didn't taste like what I thought it would. Perhaps I am used to an over sugarized American version of it.
I wish I would have gone to McDonalds for the same experience, if not better. Now I am enjoying a fresh bowl of salad because of the extra calories I sacrificed for nothing.

Can they sue you even if they cannot find you? Yes. The court will give them permission to advertise the case in the newspaper in the area where they think you are. So, if you do not appear in the suit you do not know about can they win a judgment? Yes. But now they have a judgment in a US court for US money. How will they enforce the judgment? If they can find assets of yours like bank accounts in the US, they can seize those. But if all of your money is outside the country (actually, even outside the state where the suit was brought) it will be a nightmare for them to collect the money. It will have to be taken to a foreign court and have it translated. It will just be a mess. So you are probably safe. Not 100% definitely safe but about 87% safe.

I am not sure I understand the question. However, petitions are legal. You can make a petition concerning almost anything, and get a bunch of people willing to sign their names to it. However, a petition itself is not an actual "legal document"...it is merely a document stating that X number of citizens happen to take a stand on a particular issue and urge a legislator, official, etc. to act in their favor. For example, you can make a petition in favor of banning smoking, but just because you get a bunch of people to sign it, that does not mean that smoking will be banned. The petition itself has no legal standing.

I went deep sea fishing last weekend at the invitation of a friend, and we caught, fetched, and then released some ten to fifteen fish. In order to catch those fish, we first caught a lot of bait fish, live fish that we caught the night before, then later jammed a giant hook through their still live bodies and threw them in the water. I can't find any reason to justify this behavior as moral human being. The bait fish suffered badly when caught, suffered more when we jammed a hook through their face, and suffered even more as they were stalked by larger fish, suffering then ended when they were eaten. At which point the other fish suffered with a hook through their face, fetched for their lives as I dragged them to the surface, then removed the hook and started over. I did not like it, except I did. Fishers... Change my view?

However, I disagree that such rights are simply constructs, and have no basis beyond any other construct humanity has created. While there can be some appeal to human nature, nearly all universal behaviour that could be classified as rights only apply to the "in-group" and certainly none seem to apply to humanity as a whole. The extension of rights to cover everyone a construct, and not part of fundamental human nature. This is why law exists in general. It's an extension of tribal self-rule for larger groups. There is certainly nothing about the nature of reality that causes rights to exist.

My date had a prime rib and I had a burger with three different types of meat in it. My date loved the prime rib and her mashed potatoes and my burger was cooked to a perfect medium. The only downside I would have to say was the mac and cheese. We will definitely go back!

The atmosphere is very comfortable and fits in perfectly with the Canadian theme. I have had a few dishes here, the lobster roll, PEI mussels, and boneless back rib burger, all of which I would recommend. However, the daily noodle is scarce, so I will definitely be going back.

I went in on a Monday night and there were several servers there but none came to take our drink order for 15 minutes so we left. The manager came by at one point and asked how we were doing as he walked by but he asked and kept walking. Why ask how I'm doing if you clearly do not care or want to know why?

The food was amazing and our server Samantha was very nice. However, it took the hostess a while to notice us and when she went to seat us she ran to the table leaving us running after her to catch up. Also, she may have given herself an extra $3 tip on our card charge. Our bill was $47 and some change and I left a $10 cash tip. When I looked at my bank account I had a $50 charge.
